result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon D. Taller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathon D. Taller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathon D. Taller was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Design.Drugs(>50g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham May 7, 2015 - Amend JOC to reflect adjusted credit.

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: $1406.85 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 5 Case #14CF341.

$85.50 Blood Draw to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 5 Case #14CF341.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 5 Case #14CF341.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular drug testing.
-Follow through with any programming recommended by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Maintain current mental health treatment and take prescribed medications.
-While not in treatment Defendant to be employed full time.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant not to associate with any persons known or suspected of use, manufacturing and/or sale of illegal drugs except in treatment setting.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Jonathon D. Taller appeared from jail. Case called at 11:12. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Atty.'s have rec'd copies of the PSI. Court questions and corrections to the PSI. Atty. Nelson responds to PSI corrections. Court will note letters rec'd from Atty. Nelson after the last hearing. ADA Nieskes updates the court, makes recommendations and addresses people in court whom would like to make a statement today. 

Sentencing arguments. Atty. Nelson gives the court the bifurcated sentence guidlines. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 10 years total confinement. 3 years initial confinement, 7 years extended supervision.
Court notes 261 days credit. 
- 24 mo DL revocation
- Costs of $1406.85
- $85.50 for the blood draw
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular drug testing. 
- AODA and any follow through 
- Follow through with any programming recommended by agent. 
- DNA sample.
- Maintain any current mental health treatment and take prescribed medications. 
- While not in treatment DE to be employed full time. 
- DE not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  
- DE not to associate with any persons associated with the use, manufacturing and sale of drugs unless in a therapy setting.
DE is eligible for challenge program.
DE is eligible for the substance abuse program.
Bond is revoked. 
DE remanded into custody.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Jonathon D. Taller appeared from jail. Case called 4:47. Initially set for PLEAS.  ADA Nieskes makes sentencing recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 5  in 14CF341 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 5 in 14CF341. Court finds DE competent. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1,2,3,4,6 and 7 in 14CF341. Restitution will be collected for crimes charged but dismissed. Bond is revoked. Atty's agree to a joint sentencing agreement. Court orders a PSI. Atty. Nelson mentions NG plea by mental disease or defect. Court notes withdrawl of NG plea by reason of mental disease or defect. PSI to be completed by March 27, 2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
filed by Attorney Aaron Nelson with copy of article " Updating Approaches to Client competence: Understanding the Pertinent Law and Standards of Practice".
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Jonathon D. Taller appeared from jail. Case called at 8:54. Court review file. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Atty. Nelson makes statement as to DE staying mute. Court questions DE as to competency. DE stands mute. S/T Dr. Minter.  Court notes Dr. Minter qualifications. Direct by ADA Nieskes. Ex. #1 Dr. Minter's Nov. 17, 2014 report. Court notes filing of report. Cross Atty. Nelson. Court questions Dr. Minter as to focus to evaluation. Continued Cross by Atty. Nelson. Re direct by ADA Nieskes. Ex. #1 O/R. Atty. Nelson makes statement. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court reviews 971.13(1) which defines competency. Court orders DE is competent to stand trial. Bond continues in form and amount.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.
documentation need for independent quality assurance evaluation re specimen/lab case number 14-863 filed by Atty Aaron Nelson.  kc

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson, DF:  Jonathon D. Taller appeared from jail. Set for a competency hearing. Case called at 10:307 am. Competency hearing raised by Atty Nelson. Examination has been completed and court reviews results. Atty Nelson has reviewed however, Mr. Taller has not reviewed. Atty Nelson does not agree and would like to review report with defendant. A hearing to be set parties/atty's and author. Atty Nelson does not object to telephone testimony or video conference. Attorney Nelson would prefer video conferencing. Court orders for witness to appear in person or via video conferencing.
filed by Dr Minter, Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  SEALED per SRN.  kc

Case called at 3:48 p.m. Atty Nelson states matter is not resolved. Atty Nelson states DE should be evaluated for competency. DE changes plea to not guilty by mental disease or mental defect. Court reserves on NGI at this time. Court sets for status.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:00 am.
